title: BS 7671 Maximum Demand Calculator | Electrical (UK) Diversity per IET OSG

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Single‑phase current from power: $$ I_{1\phi} = \frac{1000 \cdot P_{\mathrm{kW}}}{V \cdot \mathrm{PF}} $$ Three‑phase current from power (balanced): $$ I_{3\phi} = \frac{1000 \cdot P_{\mathrm{kW}}}{\sqrt{3} \cdot V_{\mathrm{LL}} \cdot \mathrm{PF}} $$ Cooker demand (IET OSG Table A2): $$ I_{\mathrm{d}} = 10 + 0.3 \cdot \max\!\big(I_{\mathrm{total}} - 10,\,0\big) + 5\cdot s $$ where s = 1 if a socket‑outlet is incorporated in the cooker control unit, else 0. Socket‑style “first 10 A + 30% remainder” rule: $$ I_{\mathrm{d}} = 10 + 0.3 \cdot \max\!\big(I_{\mathrm{rated}} - 10,\,0\big) + \Delta $$ with optional addition Δ (e.g., +5 A) where applicable. Lighting diversity (IET OSG Table A2): $$ I_{\mathrm{d}} = 0.66 \cdot I_{\mathrm{total}} $$ Custom diversity factor f (0–1): $$ I_{\mathrm{d}} = f \cdot I_{\mathrm{total}} $$
